title.narrative: F.a: Regional defense of territory and collective management of biodiversity

description.narrative: Through the project Latin American national groups of Friends of the Earth advance territorial management by strengthening the resistance of monocultures and commercialization of nature and by supporting initiatives and experiences related to collective ma nagement of biodiversity in Argentina, Brazil, Costa Rica, El Salvador, Colombia, Mexico and Uruguay. The project is implemented within the framework of the Forests and Biodiversity Programme as well as Food Sovereignty Programme of Friends of the Earth In ternational. During the project community context based workshops, trainings, exchanges of experiences and fora will be implemented for instance on agroecological production, collective forest management, monocultures and commercially oriented climate and environmental initiatives (REDD, PES). Surveys and publications will be produced on these themes and results will be communicated through websites, events, radio and media. Active collaboration will take place with local, national and regional social movem ents and networks. Project beneficiaries and partners consist in particular of peasant and indigenous communities as well as women?s networks. REDES is Uruguay?s Friends of the Earth. It campaigns on social and environmental themes aiming at increasing gen eral public?s awareness and influencing on political decision-making. It administrates the project. Altogether the project is implemented by seven national groups of Friends of the Earth Latin America (ATALC) in Mexico, El Salvador, Costa Rica, Colombia, A rgentina, Uruguay and Brazil. In addition to the Friends of the Earth, REDES forms part of several national and regional networks working on food sovereignty. www.redes.org.uy
